medical_history.chief_complaint: Periumbilical pain that moved to RLQ, now focal and worsening.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 1 day prior to presentation, initially periumbilical but progressed to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), becoming focal and worsening. No nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea; last bowel movement normal.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Uterine implant T12-L1 fusion s/p MVA; no prior abdominal surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of complications from brain tumor. Mother had treated tuberculosis; otherwise healthy.
